input2: Per general medicine admission note, he presented to the ED, brought in by his son, with one day of weakness, difficulty ambulating, loss of balance, left-sided constant chest pressure-like chest discomfort and dyspnea. On arrival to ED there VS 97.8 | 143/63 | 76 | 90% 2L NC, exam reportedly unremarkable. EKG w/ IV block but no ST-T changes. CXR b/l insterstitial and lower lobe alveolar edema. CT head w/o acute cranial process but chronic white matter microvascular changes. Labs significant for normal CBC, Cr 1.2 , TnT 0.01, BNP 94, AST 95, ALT 125, INR 1.8. Pt received IV Lasix and was admitted for further workup. Echo significant for LVEF, hypokinesis of inferior IVS, inf. wall, mid-distal inf.lat. wall. Seen by cardiology who recommended to keep INR therapeutic. Neurology was consulted but no consult note dictated at time of discharge. Considered MRI head but unable given ICD. Requested transfer to BID for neurology evaluation. Per discharge physical exam normal speech, normal mental status, normal strength in 4 extremities but unsteady gait.
input3:
+ Pulmonary hypertension  
+ CAD: Catheterization (per Atrius record): mild-moderate coronary artery disease, LMCA 20% stenosis, LAD 30% proximal stenosis, 60% mid RCA stenosis  
+ Glaucoma  
+ HFrEF
+ VT s/p AICD  
+ Atrial fibrillation  
+ T2DM  
+ Vitamin D deficiency  
+ Scoliosis  
+ h/o abnl LFTs  
+ pulmonary embolism, full history unknown 
+ Non-ischemic cardiomyopathy
input4:
Non contributory
From prior d/c summary:
No family history of CAD, DM, CHF or sudden death.  Brother with cancer.
input5:
Vital Signs: 97.8 | 105/49 | 74 | 22 | 85%RA --> 91% on 2L NC  
General: Alert, oriented, no acute distress. Having frequent 
negative myoclonus in his four extremities.  
HEENT: Sclera anicteric, MMM, oropharynx clear, EOMI, PERRL, 
neck supple, JVP difficult to assess, no LAD  
CV: Regular rate and rhythm, normal S1 + S2, no murmurs, rubs, gallops  
Lungs: Kyphotic chest, diffuse crackles with some scattered wheezes.  
Abdomen: mildly globulous, no collateral circulation, normal bowel sounds, soft, mildly tender diffusely without guarding, no hepatomegaly  
GU: No foley  
Ext: Warm, well perfused, 2+ pulses, no clubbing, cyanosis or edema  
Neuro: Speech is normal. Negative myoclonus as above. Between beats of myoclonus grip and strength are preserved in four extremities. Nor
